alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:05PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, southeastern Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 105 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kings Grant, or over Wilmington, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Wrightsville Beach, Surf City, Figure Eight Island, Hampstead, Topsail Beach, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Masonboro, Castle Hayne, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Phoenix, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Woodside, Mayfaire and Wrightsboro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 409 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County near mile marker 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
